alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Nemaha (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 11 at 1:55PM CDT until August 11 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Nemaha County in northeastern Kansas... Northeastern Marshall County in northeastern Kansas... * Until 230 PM CDT. * At 154 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles northeast of Summerfield, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Summerfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
